channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Book Review: The New World Economy in 5 Trends
item.description: A diligent economist and an eclectic bookworm serve up an analysis of megatrends that will have the greatest impact on economies and investments: innovation, productivity, climate, multiglobalization, debt, and aging.

item.title: Bill Gates said he wished he learned this lesson from Warren Buffett sooner: The power of an 'intentionally light' calendar
item.description: "In hindsight, it’s a lesson I could have learned a lot sooner had I taken more peeks at Warren Buffett’s intentionally light calendar."

item.title: Factor Strategies Belong in Your Completion Portfolio Toolkit
item.description: Why wouldn't you include factor strategies in your completion portfolio? A review of the two commonly used approaches for managing institutional assets highlights their symbiotic nature.

item.title: While American companies go quiet on climate change, Europeans keep banging the drum
item.description: One-pager: Concerns over culture wars and ESG investment backlash are stronger factors in the U.S. than Europe, which may lead to further divergence on net zero trajectories.

item.title: For the Analyst: Peer Benchmarking Methods to Improve Earnings Forecasts
item.description: Peer benchmarking is a vexing task for financial analysts but one that is critical for forecasting earnings. This straightforward measure can help find peers for relative performance, compensation, and valuation benchmarking.

item.title: 'Rational' monetary policies are back, says Turkey's finance chief, as he seeks to stabilize inflation-ridden economy
item.description: Turkey had kept interest rates low amid soaring inflation, against conventional wisdom, leading investors to desert its bond market.

item.title: Building LLMs in the Open-Source Community: A Call to Action for Investment Professionals
item.description: Large language models like ChatGPT are changing the way we think about investing and reshaping roles in the investment profession.

item.title: American company tells Mexico president that his $385m offer to buy its Caribbean property for ecotourism 'substantially undervalues' its crocodile-filled quarries
item.description: Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador has threatened to expropriate the property, claiming the pits it has dug to extract crushed limestone have damaged the area's fragile system of underground rivers and caves.

item.title: Sustainability Reporting: Navigating Assurance Practices
item.description: Don't be lulled into a false sense of security by the word "assurance" when evaluating sustainability reports. Assurance practices vary, and investors would be wise to learn more about the different levels of coverage.

item.title: Wisconsin law that banned collective bargaining for most public employees back in court
item.description: The court is controlled 4-3 by liberals, a flip from when it upheld the law a decade ago under 5-2 conservative control.
